name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Yesterday, Oregon along with the rest of the nation convened the Electoral College. We have 7 electors equal to the number of members of US House of Representatives and Senate who represent our great state. You can view the entire meeting online:  https://t.co/P5tBMu1kHV.

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: The Electoral College is convening today at 1:30 p.m. and can be viewed via livestream here:  https://t.co/EhQBctGg8r. #TrustedInfo2020

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Oregon experienced a record number turnout with over 2.4 million ballots cast. During a global pandemic, Oregon proved to the nation that vote by mail works, and is safe and secure.

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Today, election officials certified the 2020 General Election in Oregon. Official election results are available online:  https://t.co/vFFbCXMJOK.

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: You can read the full audit report "Oregon Has an Opportunity to Modernize Groundbreaking Bottle Bill on Its 50th Anniversary​" on our website:  https://t.co/LWvN6ar9jf.

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: @JPRnews hosted a segment with our auditors discussing a recent audit titled "Oregon Has an Opportunity to Modernize Groundbreaking Bottle Bill on Its 50th Anniversary​." You can listen to the segment here:  https://t.co/YFoMJiewlB.

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: We are happy to announce that Oregon’s 2021 Kid Governor is Taneesh Garg from Summerville K-8! Taneesh’s community issue is stopping racism. Watch Taneesh's video at  https://t.co/ay5icztW5j. Congratulations Taneesh! Learn more about the program:  https://t.co/PkyAwcr0Qh.  https://t.co/xgu6XTRg4t

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: You can follow initial election night results for Oregon on our website:  https://t.co/X8pYTN0qJ7! Unofficial results will be regularly updated throughout the evening and in the coming days. Final, certified election results will be available 30 days after the election.  https://t.co/TSC2q5Ii3p

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: You have rights as a voter. You can see the full Oregon Voter Bill of Rights in the Voting Information section of your Voters’ Pamphlet. #TrustedInfo2020  https://t.co/Wn9wrS7vV5

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: You have the right to get a “provisional ballot,” even if you are told you are not registered to vote. #TrustedInfo2020

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: You have the right to a secret vote. You do not have to tell anyone how you voted. #TrustedInfo2020

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: You have the right to vote or cast your ballot if you are in line by 8 p.m. at an official ballot drop box or county elections office. #TrustedInfo

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Election Day is here and it’s the last day to return your ballot! We encourage you to return it early today. #TrustedInfo2020

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Today is Election Hero Day, which nationally recognizes the work of our election heroes. Thank you to Oregon's election officials and their teams who work every day to ensure the safety, security and accessibility of our elections! Your dedication to democracy is inspiring!  https://t.co/l20wtf9f7o

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: We are encouraging voters to vote early, but if you are in line at 8 p.m. on election night to turn in your ballot, you have the right to vote and cast your ballot.   Official dropbox locations and virtual "I Voted" stickers are available online:  https://t.co/8VGIqPStDe.  https://t.co/K5PmyoejXD

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Voters with special circumstances such as students, military and overseas, homeless, and voters with disabilities can find more information on our website:  https://t.co/lZyNTTqaan or can call their local county election officials for assistance:  https://t.co/fyFl7wSdz8.

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Wondering if your ballot has been received by your county election office? You can check on My Vote:  https://t.co/i5bxOhTJu4.  You will hear directly from your county election office if there are any problems with verifying your signature. #TrustedInfo2020  https://t.co/oF1EmafU5E

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Unofficial ballot returns are updated daily:  https://t.co/voheG97uYw. Today we have an unofficial count of 1,695,010 or 57.5% of ballots returned! Benton County is leading in the percentage of ballot returns at 65.2%. #TrustedInfo2020 #VotebyMail  https://t.co/RWt8Naet3B

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Starting tomorrow, we recommend that you drop your ballot off instead of mailing it in. Dropbox locations:  https://t.co/8VGIqPStDe. Remember, ballots must be received at a county election office or official dropbox by 8 p.m. on November 3rd, postmarks do not count!  https://t.co/3Up1N8aQWY

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Accessibility is an important feature of our elections and ensures that voters have all the tools they need to vote. Did you know you can get assistance registering, voting, and returning your ballot?  https://t.co/6bkKePyyYV. #TrustedInfo2020 #votebymail  https://t.co/KRTpRqccTf

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Your Voters' Pamphlet is a great resource for voting. In it, we have shared some frequently asked questions that voters may find helpful. You can view them on pages 6 and 7 of the pamphlet or online:  https://t.co/TCFIf1Ahbm  https://t.co/qD2i1qBxo4

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: In addition to our Elections Division, the County Elections Officials are a trusted source of election information. They work year-round to ensure that elections are safe and secure. You can find all 36 counties' contact information on our website:  https://t.co/fyFl7wSdz8

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Voters’ pamphlets have arrived in the mail and can also be found online in multiple formats including digital audio, accessible text and a Spanish translation  https://t.co/Vg6SOFK7V9 #TrustedInfo2020 #votebymail

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Election officials started sending out ballots, you should see yours arriving in the mail soon. You can track your ballot status online at  https://t.co/i5bxOhTJu4. #TrustedInfo2020 #votebymail

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Today is the last day to register to vote for the General Election on November 3rd! Register at  https://t.co/9AODIZ4gss. Register, vote, and let's prove to the nation that our citizens are engaged and committed to democracy.

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: My latest newsletter is dedicated to providing trusted information about the upcoming election:  https://t.co/XvrXTzEoGn

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: For any Oregonians displaced from their home and concerned about voting in the General Election this November, rest assured we are working closely with local election officials to ensure you receive your ballot.  https://t.co/kpyjMmXnql.  https://t.co/MXMq1Z6MKX

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: It is National Voter Registration Day! Please take a moment to register if you are eligible. To vote in the General Election on November 3, the deadline to register is October 13. To register or verify your current information please visit  https://t.co/23UsISeucD.  https://t.co/D1kuq80rFt

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: I’m proud of the work our Corporation Division has done to make #RemoteOnlineNotarization a reality. Oregonians now have safer options to perform notarizations without sacrificing security or identity protections. This comes at a time when health & safety is particularly crucial.

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: ICYMI: This week, I discussed Oregon’s vote-by-mail system with @BillWhitakerCBS on @60Minutes. Oregon’s system is very secure & produces some of the highest voter turnout rates in the country. As I’ve said before, our experience with vote-by-mail is a 20-year history of success.

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Read my latest newsletter for summaries of recent audits, resources for small businesses, and more:  https://t.co/fN4eCHSFVL  https://t.co/dEFZJq9BGd

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: While some voters dropped off their ballots at official drop boxes like usual, others found that the new prepaid return envelopes made it even easier to participate w/o leaving their homes. The results are now officially certified & posted on our website:  https://t.co/OiFwnACA1m

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Last month, Oregon held a primary election in the midst of a global pandemic. Over 1.3 million ballots were cast, which is a record number for any primary! Because Oregon has vote by mail, we were able to hold an election that looked much like any other...

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: The Reopen Oregon Business Survey is ready for use! This voluntary survey is meant for businesses to identify that they are open, provide details about services they provide. Survey:  https://t.co/vUrATPB8Fk. Searchable map:  https://t.co/JNAfePiShS

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: .@OregonAudits recently released a report explaining that, while more time is needed in part due to #COVID19, DAS has partially implemented each of the 2018 report’s recommendations and is on track for full implementation. Read the follow-up report here:  https://t.co/9GFx6P6yJE

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: In December 2018, @OregonAudits released a report explaining how the state’s procurement system and practices could be improved to reduce risk and allow for potentially millions of dollars in cost savings. You can read the 2018 report here:  https://t.co/4e1IG3v9fc

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: You may know that @OregonDAS oversees procurement for state agencies. Procurement is the process by which state government purchases the things that it takes to run a state, from office supplies to heavy equipment. The state spends billions in procurements each biennium.  https://t.co/i13j0RNbY5

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Read the @OregonAudits annual report on the hotline here:  https://t.co/zYvJcCmSEG

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Did you know there’s a hotline where Oregonians can report government fraud, waste, and abuse? The hotline can be reached at 1-800-336-8218 or online at  https://t.co/h9AMjDOShI. To date, it has identified approximately $16 million in questioned costs.  https://t.co/HGu0ZOpiTV

name: Secretary of State Shemia Fagan
tweet: Did you know there’s a hotline where Oregonians can report government fraud, waste, and abuse? The hotline can be reached at 800-336-8218 or online at  https://t.co/h9AMjDOShI. To date, it has identified approximately $16 million in questioned costs.  https://t.co/HGu0ZOpiTV
